contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Upper Hutt suburbs | name = Trentham | image = | caption1 = | city1 = | city2 = | ward = | established = 1840's <ref>http://www.ppa.org.nz/history Pinehaven Progressive Association - History</ref> | area = | population = 3,789 | popdate = 2006 | trainstations = [[Trentham Railway Station]] | ferryterminals = | airports = | hospitals = | north = [[Riverstone Terraces]] | northeast = [[Elderslea]] | east = [[Wallaceville]] | southeast = | south = | southwest = [[Heretaunga]] | west = | northwest = | map = | caption2 = }} '''Trentham''' is the most populous suburb of [[Upper Hutt]], a city in the [[Wellington]] region of [[New Zealand]]. The suburb is located in a widening of the [[Hutt Valley]], five kilometres to the southwest of the Upper Hutt city centre. The name "Trentham" was initially given by [[Richard Barton]], the first European Settler in the area, in honour of his former employer, the [[Duke of Sutherland]]. One of the Duke of Sutherland's subsidiary titles was '''Viscount Trentham''', of Trentham in the County of Stafford. Due to the New Zealand tendency towards [[spelling pronunciation|spelling pronunciations]], the name is invariably pronounced {{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|r|ɛ|n|.|θ|əm|'}}, rather than the traditional English pronunciation {{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|r|ɛ|n|t|.|h|əm}}. The suburb is home to the [[Trentham Racecourse]], the base of the [[Wellington Racing Club]] (WRC), the site of [[Hutt International Boys' School]] and is also the site of the [[Trentham Military Camp]], which was used extensively for training soldiers in preparation for [[World War I]] and is still a base for the [[NZ Army]] and Defence Force. [[Barton's Bush]] is located in Trentham. ==Education== * '''Trentham School''' is a state contributing primary school (years 1-6). It has a roll of 450 and a [[Socio-Economic Decile|decile rating]] of 4. <ref>[http://www.tki.org.nz/e/schools/display_school_info.php?school_id=2099 Te Kete Ipurangi schools database]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.nzetc.org/tm/scholarly/WH2Petr-fig-WH2PetrP002a.html Photo of Trentham Camp 1939] *[http://www.nzetc.org/tm/scholarly/tei-WarEarl-t1-body-d21-d2.html#WarEarl-fig-WarEarl382a Photo of Trentham Camp 1914-1918] * [http://www.nzetc.org/tm/scholarly/WH2-1Hom-fig-WH2-1Hom008a.html View of Race Meeting, Trentham 1943] * [http://www.nzetc.org/tm/scholarly/WH2Econ-fig-WH2Eco103b.html Payout at Race Meeting Trentham 1943] {{coord|-41.13|175.04|format=dm|display=title|type:city_region:NZ}} [[Category:Suburbs of Upper Hutt]] {{Wellington-geo-stub}}
